SEARCH
Package com.api.synco.core.security.jwt

Class JwtTokenProvider

java.lang.Object
com.api.synco.core.security.jwt.JwtTokenProvider
@Component public class JwtTokenProvider extends Object
Provider class for JWT token operations.

This component handles all JWT-related operations including:

  • Token generation with configurable expiration
  • Token validation and parsing
  • Claims extraction from tokens
  • User email extraction from tokens

The JWT tokens are signed using the HMAC-SHA256 algorithm with a secret key configured via application properties.

Configuration properties:

  • jwt.secret - The secret key for signing tokens
  • jwt.token.validity - Token validity in milliseconds
Since:
1.0.0
Version:
1.0.0
Author:
Luca5Eckert

  • Constructor Details

    • JwtTokenProvider

      public JwtTokenProvider(@Value("${jwt.secret}") String secret, @Value("${jwt.token.validity}") long validityInMilliseconds)
      Constructs a new JWT token provider with the specified configuration.
      Parameters:
      secret - the secret key for signing tokens (must not be null or empty)
      validityInMilliseconds - the token validity period in milliseconds
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the secret is null or empty

  • Method Details

    • generateToken

      public String generateToken(String email)
      Generates a JWT token for the specified user email.

      The generated token includes:

      • Subject set to the user's email
      • Email claim
      • Issue timestamp
      • Expiration timestamp based on configured validity
      Parameters:
      email - the user's email to include in the token
      Returns:
      the generated JWT token as a string

    • validateToken

      public boolean validateToken(String token)
      Validates a JWT token.

      This method attempts to parse the token and returns true if the token is valid (properly signed, not expired, and well-formed).

      Parameters:
      token - the JWT token to validate
      Returns:
      true if the token is valid, false otherwise

    • parseClaims

      public io.jsonwebtoken.Claims parseClaims(String token)
      Parses and validates the claims from a JWT token.

      This method validates the token's signature, expiration, and format, throwing appropriate exceptions for different failure scenarios.

      Parameters:
      token - the JWT token to parse
      Returns:
      the Claims extracted from the token
      Throws:
      TokenInvalidException - if the token is null, empty, expired, malformed, has an invalid signature, or is unsupported

    • getUserEmail

      public String getUserEmail(String token)
      Extracts the user email from a JWT token.

      The email is extracted from either the "email" claim or the subject claim.

      Parameters:
      token - the JWT token
      Returns:
      the user's email extracted from the token
      Throws:
      TokenInvalidException - if the token is invalid or does not contain an email
